citations.narrative:
The following housekeeping issues were noted:
-In a transitional hallway there was a mild to moderate accumulation of dust and debris underneath and behind the supply
storage racks.
-In the large multipurpose room, around the windowsill, there were at least 3 cobwebs approximately 3 inches in size. One
wall had an approximately 1-foot X 1-foot section where the paint was peeling off. At least 2 ceiling tiles were beginning to
separate from their support structure and there was an approximately 2-inch X 1-inch section missing from one ceiling tile.
-In the small multipurpose room, there was a mild to moderate accumulation of dust and debris in the corners and under
the sink. Also, the stacked items on the ground next to the sink appeared to impede adequate cleaning in this area.
Failure to maintain premises as required may affect the health and well-being of the animals.
Premises (buildings and grounds) shall be kept clean and in good repair in order to protect the animals from injury and to
facilitate the prescribed husbandry practices set forth in this subpart. Accumulations of discarded items shall be placed in
designated areas and cleared as necessary to protect the health of the animals.
To be corrected by August 15, 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.131(c) 
   
Sanitation. 
The following housekeeping issues were noted: 
-In a transitional hallway there was a mild to moderate accumulation of dust and debris underneath and behind the supply 
storage racks. 
-In the large multipurpose room, around the windowsill, there were at least 3 cobwebs approximately 3 inches in size. One 
wall had an approximately 1-foot X 1-foot section where the paint was peeling off. At least 2 ceiling tiles were beginning to 
separate from their support structure and there was an approximately 2-inch X 1-inch section missing from one ceiling tile. 
-In the small multipurpose room, there was a mild to moderate accumulation of dust and debris in the corners and under 
the sink. Also, the stacked items on the ground next to the sink appeared to impede adequate cleaning in this area.  
 
Failure to maintain premises as required may affect the health and well-being of the animals. 
 
Premises (buildings and grounds) shall be kept clean and in good repair in order to protect the animals from injury and to 
facilitate the prescribed husbandry practices set forth in this subpart. Accumulations of discarded items shall be placed in 
designated areas and cleared as necessary to protect the health of the animals. 
To be corrected by August 15, 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives. 
 
 n

species.common: CONGO AFRICAN GREY PARROT / GRAY PARROT

species.scientific: Ara, Anodorhynchus, Primolius, Diopsittaca spp hybrid
